ygData.subject: Money money money ...
ygData.msgSnippet: Now i know some of you are thinking, didnt we talk about this!? This is my two cents on the whole deal, and im by far the best source for this info.  But i do
ygData.messageBody:
Now i know some of you are thinking, didnt we talk about this!?

This is my two cents on the whole deal, and im by far the best
source for this info. But i do know a few spots to make some
money so ...

First off, the only time you need to worry about cash is if:
1) you REALLY need the eq someone is selling/need to buy from
someone.

2)you want to twink the hell outa your next character.

Nuff' said there, mostly its going to be 1 until you hit the
upper levels then its most 2.

So, you cant make money at low levels. Well, thats cause you
CANT! deal with it. No level 5 character can go make money
like a level 50 char can. So start spending some time in
your favorite seat cause, your arse is gonna need to love it!


- = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = -
So, i start this at about 10+. This is based off my exsperience
so, since i was a melee class, i dont really know how this will
effect you. And faction may just cause you to NOT be able to
do this also.

Erud's Crossing.
This has to be the best spot for wisp hunting. The island
spawns non aggressive bugs, wisps, and the occasional undead.
For those SK's and necros, thats a decent plus. You NEED!
and i cant stress the NEED enough a magical weapon. I always
made sure my monk had magical gloves as soon as he could take
the frogloks in the sewers of Qeynos. So, Head on over to
Qeynos, its the first stop on the way to Erudin. They have
a vedor on the island.
Pick up a spit, a fishing rod, and may some grubs for the trip
there. Work that cooking skill up a bit before you leave.
Look to get a bind at the docks in Qeynos, or if a caster bind
at the docks on the Crossing.
Why a spit!? Why the rod?
You want to minimize the costs while here and maximize the
income! Fish while resting at the docks, use the spit to
make fish cakes, and eat that rather then buy over priced food.

Now then - Simply put, hunt wisps night and day.
I try to avoid groups like the plague except when i find some
one that complements me, a healer for melee and melee for
casters. The wisps are good for atleast 4 levels of money.
Up until 15, last i remember do they give you experience.
If they changed this, let me know cause i was thinking of
starting a new character.

Thats basicly it from 10-15, ill work on a good spot for 15+
for the next post.
Anyone car argue, but to prove me wrong is something else.
So if you dont think this is a good spot, start a character
and TRY IT YOURSELF! Dont complain to me ...
